<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- -->
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	409,770
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- -->
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	671,114
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_DG42701_ITEM_7__MANAGEMENT_S_DISCUSSIO__ITE03668">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DG42701_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following discussion and analysis should be read in conjunction with our consolidated financial statements, including the notes
	thereto.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Overview
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ITG is an independent broker and financial technology firm that improves the efficiency and execution quality of institutional trading.
	ITG helps clients understand market trends, mitigate risk and navigate increasingly complex markets. A leader in electronic trading since launching the POSIT crossing network in 1987, ITG takes a
	consultative approach in delivering the highest quality execution and liquidity solutions along with analytical tools and research. The firm is headquartered in New York with offices in North America,
	Europe, and the Asia Pacific region.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	business is organized into four reportable operating segments (see Note&nbsp;22,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Segment Reporting
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, to the consolidated financial
	statements):
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S. Operations
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Canadian Operations
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	European Operations
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Asia Pacific Operations
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	27
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=30,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=903575,FOLIO='27',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DG42701A.;12',USER='KSEAMON',CD='28-FEB-2016;15:41' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DG42701_1_28">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	four operating segments provide the following types of products and services:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Electronic Brokerage&#151;includes self-directed trading by clients using algorithms, smart routing and matching through POSIT
	in cash equities (including single stocks and portfolio lists), futures and options;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Research, Sales and Trading&#151;includes (a)&nbsp;differentiated, unbiased, data-driven equity research through the use of
	innovative data harvesting and analysis and (b)&nbsp;portfolio trading and high-touch trading desks providing execution expertise and trading ideas based on investment research;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Platforms&#151;includes trade order and execution management software applications in addition to network connectivity; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Analytics&#151;includes (a)&nbsp;tools enabling portfolio managers and traders to improve pre-trade and real-time execution
	performance, (b)&nbsp;portfolio construction and optimization decisions and (c)&nbsp;securities valuation.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
	in the first quarter of 2015, the Company is presenting its regional segment results excluding the impact of corporate activity. For this purpose, corporate activity includes
	investment income and other gains as well as costs not associated with operating the businesses within the Company's regional segments. These costs include, among others, (a)&nbsp;the costs of being
	a public company, such as certain staff costs, a portion of external audit fees, and reporting, filing and listing costs, (b)&nbsp;intangible asset amortization, (c)&nbsp;interest expense,
	(d)&nbsp;professional fees associated with our global transfer pricing structure, (e)&nbsp;foreign exchange gains or losses and (f)&nbsp;certain non-operating expenses. Prior to this change in
	segment measure, corporate activity was included in the region where the income/expense was earned/incurred, which primarily was in the U.S. Operations segment. Prior period segment data has been
	restated to conform to the 2015 presentation.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sources of Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenues from our products and services are generated from commissions and fees, recurring (subscriptions) and other sources.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Commissions
	and fees are derived primarily from (i)&nbsp;commissions charged for trade execution services, (ii)&nbsp;income generated on net executions, whereby equity orders are
	filled at different prices within or at the National Best Bid and Offer ("NBBO") and (iii)&nbsp;commission sharing arrangements between ITG Net (our private value-added FIX-based financial
	electronic communications network) and third-party brokers and alternative trading systems whose trading products are made available to our clients on our order management system ("OMS") and execution
	management system ("EMS") applications in addition to commission sharing arrangements for our ITG Single Ticket Clearing Service and our ITG RFQ-hub request-for-quote service. Because commissions are
	earned on a per-transaction basis, such revenues fluctuate from period to period depending on (a)&nbsp;the volume of securities traded through our services in the U.S. and Canada, (b)&nbsp;the
	contract value of securities traded in Europe and the Asia Pacific region and (c)&nbsp;our commission rates. Certain factors that affect our volumes and contract values traded include:
	(i)&nbsp;macro trends in the global equities markets that affect overall institutional equity trading activity, (ii)&nbsp;competitive pressure, including pricing, created by a proliferation of
	electronic execution competitors and (iii)&nbsp;potential changes in market structure in the U.S. and other regions. In addition to share volume, revenues from net executions are also impacted by
	the width of spreads within the NBBO. Trade orders are delivered to us from our OMS and EMS products and other vendors' products, direct computer-to-computer links to customers through ITG Net and
	third-party networks and phone orders from our customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recurring
	revenues are derived from the following primary sources: (i)&nbsp;connectivity fees generated through ITG Net for the ability of the sell-side to receive orders from, and
	send indications of interest
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	28
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=31,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=192926,FOLIO='28',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DG42701A.;12',USER='KSEAMON',CD='28-FEB-2016;15:41' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DG42701_1_29">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to,
	the buy-side and for the sell-side to receive requests-for-quotes through ITG RFQ-hub, (ii)&nbsp;subscription revenue generated from providing research, (iii)&nbsp;software and analytical
	products and services and (iv)&nbsp;maintenance and customer technical support for ITG OMS.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	revenues include: (1)&nbsp;income from principal trading in the Company's Canadian Operations, including arbitrage trading, (2)&nbsp;the net spread on foreign exchange
	transactions executed on a principal basis to facilitate equity trades by clients in different currencies, as well as on other foreign currency transactions unrelated to equity trading, (3)&nbsp;the
	net interest spread earned on securities borrowed and loaned matched book transactions, (4)&nbsp;transaction advisory services provided to potential purchasers of energy-related investments,
	(5)&nbsp;non-recurring consulting services, such as one-time implementation and customer-training-related activities, (6)&nbsp;investment and interest income, (7)&nbsp;interest income on
	securities borrowed in connection with customers' settlement activities, (8)&nbsp;market gains/losses resulting from temporary positions in securities assumed in the normal course of agency trading
	(including client errors and accommodations) and (9)&nbsp;non-recurring gains and losses such as divestitures.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation and employee benefits, our largest expense, consist of salaries and wages, incentive compensation, employee benefits and
	taxes. Incentive compensation fluctuates based on revenues, profitability and other measures, taking into account the landscape for key talent. Incentive compensation includes a combination of cash
	and deferred share-based awards. Only the cash portion of incentive compensation is a variable expense in the current period. As a result, our ratio of compensation expense to revenues may fluctuate
	from period-to-period based on revenue levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transaction
	processing expense consists of costs to access various third-party execution destinations and to process, clear and settle transactions. These costs tend to fluctuate with
	share and trade volumes, the mix of trade execution services used by clients and the rates charged by third parties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Occupancy
	and equipment expense consists primarily of rent and utilities related to leased premises, office equipment and depreciation and amortization of fixed assets and leasehold
	improvements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Telecommunications
	and data processing expenses primarily consist of costs for obtaining market data, data associated with our investment research offerings, telecommunications services
	and systems maintenance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	general and administrative expenses primarily include software amortization, consulting, business development, professional fees and intangible asset amortization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	expense consists primarily of costs associated with outstanding debt and credit facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Non-GAAP Financial Measures
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To supplement our financial information presented in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the U.S.
	("U.S.&nbsp;GAAP"), management uses certain "non-GAAP financial measures" as such term is defined in SEC Regulation&nbsp;G. Generally, a non-GAAP financial measure is a numerical measure of a
	company's operating performance, financial position or cash flows that excludes or includes amounts that are included in, or excluded from, the most directly comparable measure calculated and
	presented in accordance with U.S.&nbsp;GAAP. Management believes the presentation of these measures provides investors with greater transparency and supplemental data relating to our financial
	condition and results of operations, and therefore a more complete understanding of factors affecting our business than U.S.&nbsp;GAAP measures alone. In addition, management believes the
	presentation of these measures is useful to investors for period-to-period comparison of results as the items described below reflect certain unique and/or non-operating items
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	29
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=32,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=309936,FOLIO='29',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DG42701A.;12',USER='KSEAMON',CD='28-FEB-2016;15:41' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DG42701_1_30">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	such
	as acquisitions, divestitures, restructuring charges, large write-offs or items outside of management's control.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted
	revenues, adjusted expenses and adjusted net income together with related per share amounts are non-GAAP performance measures that we believe are useful to assist investors in
	gaining an understanding of the trends and operating results for our core business. These measures should be viewed in addition to, and not in lieu of, results reported under U.S.&nbsp;GAAP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reconciliations
	of adjusted revenues, adjusted expenses and adjusted net income to revenues, expenses and net income and related per share amounts as determined in accordance with
	U.S.&nbsp;GAAP for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2013 are provided below, as applicable (dollars in thousands, except per share amounts). There were no such adjustments during the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=1>
<B>
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015:
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCROPPEDRULE,112PT -->
</B>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TH>
<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
<B>
	U.S.
</B>
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
<B>
	Canada
</B>
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
<B>
	Europe
</B>
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	December 2015, we completed the sale of the subsidiaries conducting our energy research business to an affiliate of Warburg Pincus, a global private
	equity firm, for $120.5&nbsp;million. The pre-tax gain of $107.7&nbsp;million is net of a working capital adjustment on the closing balance sheet, direct costs related to the sale, including
	share-based compensation costs, and the carrying value of the net assets disposed.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	August 2015, we reached a final settlement with the SEC to pay an aggregate amount of $20.3&nbsp;million in connection with the SEC's investigation
	into a proprietary trading pilot operated in 2010 and 2011. During 2015, we incurred $4.9&nbsp;million in legal and related costs associated with this matter.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	December 2015, we amended the capital structure of our principal holding company outside North America to provide continued flexibility for the movement
	of global capital. This amendment accelerated the U.S. taxation of amounts earned outside of North America resulting in a tax charge of $6.5&nbsp;million.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	the second quarter of 2013, we incurred a $1.6&nbsp;million charge to implement a restructuring plan to close our technology research and development
	facility in Israel and migrate that function to an outsourced-service-provider model effective January&nbsp;1, 2014. This plan primarily focused on reducing costs by limiting our geographic
	footprint while maintaining the necessary technological expertise via a consulting arrangement. This restructuring plan triggered the recognition of a tax charge of $1.6&nbsp;million in the second
	quarter of 2013 associated with the anticipated withdrawal of capital from Israel. We also reduced previously-recorded 2012 and 2011 restructuring accruals of $1.6&nbsp;million to reflect the
	sub-lease of previously-vacated office space and certain legal and other employee-related charges deemed unnecessary.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(5)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	the fourth quarter of 2012, we began to build out and ready our new lower Manhattan headquarters while continuing to occupy our then-existing
	headquarters in midtown Manhattan and as a result incurred duplicate rent charges through June 2013.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	31
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=34,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=664114,FOLIO='31',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DG42701A.;12',USER='KSEAMON',CD='28-FEB-2016;15:41' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DG42701_1_32">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(6)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	the second quarter of 2013, we moved into our new headquarters and incurred a one-time non-operating charge, which included a reserve for the remaining
	lease obligation for the previous midtown Manhattan headquarters.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Executive Summary for the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Consolidated Overview
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our 2015 results reflect the significant negative impact on our business from the SEC Settlement in August 2015. Immediately following
	the preliminary announcement of the SEC Settlement in late July, we experienced a sharp drop in trading activity as a number of clients either suspended or significantly reduced the amount of trade
	flow sent to ITG. Management has worked actively to reassure clients of the integrity of our business through face-to-face meetings and due diligence processes that have resulted in substantially all
	of our clients resuming some level of trading with ITG. Average daily trading commissions in the U.S. during the fourth quarter were 12% better than the lows of August and September with buy-side
	trading activity showing signs of stabilization. While the momentum in our recovery has been consistent, the full restoration of our business remains a work in progress.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	2015 results also include the December sale of our energy research business to an affiliate of Warburg Pincus, a global private equity firm, for $120.5&nbsp;million resulting in a
	pre-tax gain of $107.7&nbsp;million and an after-tax gain of $91.4&nbsp;million, or $2.66 per share ("Energy Research Sale"). Having monetized the significant value in the energy research
	business, we are currently evaluating alternatives for the use of the net proceeds. Based on 2015 results, the Energy Research Sale is expected to reduce annual revenues by approximately
	$20&nbsp;million and reduce annual expenses by approximately $6&nbsp;million, net of a new licensing charge to distribute the energy research product to our trading clients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	a U.S.&nbsp;GAAP basis, we earned net income of $91.6&nbsp;million, or $2.63 per diluted share in 2015. Our U.S.&nbsp;GAAP results include the gain from the Energy Research Sale
	as well as $25.2&nbsp;million in costs related to the SEC Settlement and a $6.5&nbsp;million tax charge to amend the capital structure of our operations outside of North America. This capital
	structure amendment will provide continued
	flexibility with the movement of global capital without incremental tax costs. Adjusted net income (see
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Non-GAAP Financial Measures
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) was
	$29.8&nbsp;million, or $0.86 per diluted share compared to $50.9&nbsp;million, or $1.40 per diluted share for 2014, due primarily to a 6% reduction in revenues, excluding the gain on the Energy
	Research Sale. Expenses of $513.6&nbsp;million were 4% higher than 2014 while adjusted expenses (see
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Non-GAAP Financial Measures
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) of
	$488.4&nbsp;million, which excluded the costs related to the SEC Settlement, decreased 1% from the prior year. The reduction in expenses was largely driven by lower compensation costs from
	compensation reversals associated with the management changes announced in August, mark-to-market adjustments on stock awards to Canadian employees that will be settled in cash and lower revenues and
	profitability. Costs were also lowered as compared to 2014 due to the exchange rate impact from the stronger U.S. Dollar.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Segment Discussions
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Regional segment results exclude the impact of corporate activity. In 2015, corporate activity increased pre-tax income by
	$64.7&nbsp;million on a U.S.&nbsp;GAAP basis and decreased pre-tax income by $17.8&nbsp;million on an adjusted basis, excluding the impact of the Energy Research Sale and the costs related to
	the SEC Settlement. In 2014, corporate activity reduced pre-tax income by $20.5&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;U.S.
	commission revenues were 9% lower in 2015 reflecting the sharp drop in our customer trading activity following the SEC Settlement. Our U.S. average daily volume was
	162.2&nbsp;million shares, virtually flat with 2014, trailing the 8% growth in U.S. consolidated daily market volume. Although our total volumes were relatively unchanged, a larger portion of our
	volumes were from sell-side accounts
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	32
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=35,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=82156,FOLIO='32',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DG42701A.;12',USER='KSEAMON',CD='28-FEB-2016;15:41' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DG42701_1_33">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	due
	in part to our efforts to grow this business. Sell-side trading volume increased to 59% of overall volume, compared to 52% in 2014, diluting our overall revenue capture rate per share to $0.0043
	compared to $0.0047 in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	Canada, commissions and fees were down 18% as sharply lower business levels in the fourth quarter following the SEC Settlement and a 14% reduction in the average Canadian dollar
	exchange rate offset a strong start to the year. MATCH Now's volume grew by more than 30% during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	European business has held up well in the wake of our SEC Settlement, although growth in our trading activity was offset by a 7% decline in the average British Pound exchange rate.
	In local
	currency terms, market-wide trading activity was up nearly 16%, according to BATS Global Markets&nbsp;Inc., driven by increased market volatility during the first half of the year. In comparison,
	the value traded by ITG Europe grew 30% in local currency terms and 20% in U.S. Dollar terms. While growth in our value traded in Europe exceeded market growth, like the U.S., a greater portion was
	from sell-side accounts. We continued our strategy of growing the liquidity on our platform by expanding our sell-side client business and our business across continental Europe, which enabled us to
	capitalize on the improved market activity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	last two quarters in 2015 were challenging periods for our Asia Pacific business. After a strong first half of the year, when we achieved record profitability in both the first and
	second quarters, our Asia Pacific business struggled in the last two quarters following the SEC Settlement. Much of the decline is due to a drop-off in trading activity by U.S. based clients in the
	wake of the SEC Settlement. While the reduction in commissions in the second half of the year ended our run of four consecutive quarters of profitability, we were still able to generate a pre-tax
	profit of $1.6&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to a pre-tax loss of $1.7&nbsp;million in 2014 due to a 3% growth in revenues and a 4% reduction in costs from cost savings initiatives implemented in
	late 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Capital Resource Allocation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During 2015, we repurchased 2.0&nbsp;million shares under our stock repurchase program for $42.0&nbsp;million. We intend to
	continue to use share repurchases to offset dilution from the issuance of stock under employee compensation plans and to opportunistically return capital to stockholders, depending on market
	conditions and any strategic activity that may necessitate alternative uses of capital. We may elect to conduct future share repurchases through open market purchases, private transactions or
	automatic share repurchase programs under SEC Rule&nbsp;10b5-1.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2015, our Board of Directors initiated a dividend program under which we began to pay quarterly dividends, subject to quarterly declarations by the Board of Directors. During
	2015, our Board of Directors declared and we paid quarterly cash dividends of $0.07 per share in each of the second, third and fourth quarters totaling $7.0&nbsp;million, in the aggregate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	33
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;While
	total annual volumes were essentially unchanged, commissions and fees decreased 9% reflecting the higher proportion of average daily volumes executed by lower-priced sell-side
	clients, which increased to 59% of our volumes compared to 52% in 2014, adversely impacting our revenue per share. Following the SEC Settlement we saw a decline in trading activity from some buy-side
	clients that either suspended trading or significantly reduced the amount of trade flow sent to ITG. While substantially all of the accounts that suspended trading with ITG have resumed sending some
	level of trade flow, much work remains to bring all of our clients back to the level of engagement we experienced prior to the SEC Settlement. This decline in buy-side trade flow also had a negative
	impact on sell-side activity as there was less liquidity in POSIT, resulting in fewer crossing opportunities.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_11"></A>

</FONT>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	*
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Excludes
	activity from ITG Net commission share arrangements.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recurring
	revenues increased due to higher research subscriptions in addition to higher connectivity fees. Connectivity fees increased primarily from an increase in revenue from global
	connections previously recorded in our Canadian and Asia Pacific Operations segments, as a result of a change in our attribution method, and an increase in revenue from connections delivered out of
	the ITG PM solution. These increases in connectivity revenue were partially offset by connections lost due to the impact of client attrition from our OMS product. Research subscriptions increased from
	higher subscription revenues from new accounts subscribing to our investment research products and a shift in the recognition of certain corporate subscriptions revenue in energy research to the U.S.
	Operations segment from the Canadian Operations segment, partially offset by the impact of the discontinuation of our healthcare market research business in May 2015. The Energy Research Sale is
	expected to reduce recurring revenues in the U.S. Operations segment by approximately $18&nbsp;million in 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	34
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=37,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=53260,FOLIO='34',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DI42701A.;10',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='24-FEB-2016;11:21' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DI42701_1_35">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	revenues decreased primarily due to declines in transaction advisory services revenues from our energy research team and lower net revenue earned from stock loan matched book
	transactions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation
	and employee benefits costs decreased as a result of lower incentive-based compensation to our management team associated with global profitability levels and with lower
	headcount at the end of the year. As a percentage of revenues, compensation costs increased to 45.1% as compared to 42.4% in 2014 due to the impact of the fixed components of compensation costs on
	lower revenues and our need to retain staff during this challenging period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transaction
	processing costs increased due to an increase in the proportion of trading by clients where liquidity was taken (which typically costs more than transactions in which clients
	are providing liquidity on an execution venue), more settlement tickets processed and higher costs from outsourcing the clearing of select accounts to a third party. These factors, along with the
	impact of our lower average revenue per share, increased transaction processing costs as a percentage of commissions and fees to 21.2% from 17.8% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	expenses decreased $3.5&nbsp;million due to a higher credit for research and development costs charged to other segments as more of these resources have been centralized in the
	U.S., along with lower depreciation and software amortization.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_12"></A>

</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Currency
	translation from a weaker Canadian Dollar decreased total Canadian revenues and expenses by $9.8&nbsp;million and $7.2&nbsp;million, respectively, resulting in a decrease of
	$2.6&nbsp;million to pre-tax income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Canadian
	commissions and fees were down 18% as the impact of the SEC Settlement and a weaker Canadian dollar offset strong trading levels in the early part of the year. MATCH Now's
	volume grew by more than 30% during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recurring
	revenues decreased primarily from lower revenue from global connections due to a change in our attribution method and from a shift in the recognition of energy research
	subscription revenue from corporate accounts to the U.S. Operations segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	revenues increased due to higher principal trading gains on inter-listed arbitrage trading.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation
	and employee benefits costs decreased due to currency translation and lower incentive compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	35
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=38,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=11139,FOLIO='35',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DI42701A.;10',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='24-FEB-2016;11:21' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DI42701_1_36">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transaction
	processing costs decreased due to the favorable impact from currency translation of $1.3&nbsp;million, partially offset by higher costs associated with increased principal
	trading activity and higher execution charges on shares traded in the U.S. by Canadian clients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	expenses were down due to the impact of currency translation as well as reductions to facilities costs, consulting fees and research distribution fees paid to the U.S. Operations.
	These decreases were slightly offset by higher market data costs.
</FONT>
</P>

</P>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Currency
	translation from a weaker British Pound decreased European revenues and expenses by $10.1&nbsp;million and $7.9&nbsp;million, respectively, diminishing pre-tax income by
	$2.2&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;European
	results in 2015 include the results of ITG RFQ-hub for a full year versus five months in 2014 following the July&nbsp;30, 2014 acquisition date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	European commissions and fees were flat with 2014 despite an unfavorable currency impact of $8.9&nbsp;million and a lower average commission rate primarily due to an increase in
	sell-side clients trading in POSIT and an increase in institutional clients using our trading algorithms. While the growth in our value traded was nearly twice the growth rate of overall European
	value traded, an increased portion was from sell-side clients. Although we earn a lower commission rate on sell-side trading, this activity produces incremental profitability, uses excess capacity and
	grows the liquidity in POSIT.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recurring
	revenue increased primarily from a full period of ITG RFQ-hub activity as compared to only five months in 2014 as well as an increase in billed analytics revenue. Other
	revenues improved due to a lower impact of trade errors and client accommodations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation
	and benefits increased due to higher salaries from a full period of ITG RFQ-hub, investments in our sales team and higher deferred stock-based compensation associated with
	awards granted for 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transaction
	processing costs increased as a result of an increase in the average daily notional value traded. As a percentage of commissions and fees, transaction processing costs
	increased to 26.3% from 23.5% in 2014 due to the impact of a higher proportion of value traded by lower-rate, sell-side clients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	expenses increased due to higher charges for global research and development costs, increases in business development and customer connectivity costs and a full period of costs
	from ITG RFQ-hub.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	36
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	nm&#151;Not
	meaningful
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Currency
	translation from a weaker Australian Dollar decreased total Asia Pacific revenues by $5.1&nbsp;million and expenses by $2.6&nbsp;million, reducing our pre-tax profit by
	$2.5&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Asia
	Pacific commissions and fees increased despite unfavorable currency translation and the impact of the SEC Settlement in the second half of 2015 due to strong order flow earlier in
	the year by U.S. clients and local Asian clients trading into Australia and Hong Kong and the increased use of our trading algorithms and our POSIT Alert block crossing system.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recurring
	revenues decreased primarily from lower revenue earned from global connections due to a change in our attribution method and currency translation. Other revenues improved due
	to lower client accommodations and errors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation
	and employee benefits decreased due to lower headcount, reduced severance charges and favorable currency translation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transaction
	processing costs decreased due to a higher proportion of our trading in markets where our costs are lower. As a percentage of commissions and fees, these costs declined to
	24.2% from 25.7% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	expenses increased primarily because of the higher charges for global research and development costs, higher software amortization and consulting expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Corporate
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Corporate activity includes investment income and other gains as well as costs not associated with operating the businesses within our
	regional segments. These costs include, among others, (a)&nbsp;the costs of being a public company, such as certain staff costs, a portion of external audit fees, and reporting, filing and listing
	costs, (b)&nbsp;intangible asset amortization, (c)&nbsp;interest expense, (d)&nbsp;professional fees associated with our global transfer pricing structure, (e)&nbsp;foreign exchange gains or
	losses and (f)&nbsp;certain non-operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	2015, we reported pre-tax income from Corporate activity of $64.7&nbsp;million, reflecting the $107.7&nbsp;million gain on the Energy Research Sale, $0.9&nbsp;million of
	investment income and $43.9&nbsp;million of costs. For 2014, we incurred a pre-tax loss from Corporate activity of $20.5&nbsp;million, reflecting
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	37
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=40,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=766360,FOLIO='37',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DI42701A.;10',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='24-FEB-2016;11:21' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DI42701_1_38">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	investment
	income of $1.3&nbsp;million and costs of $21.8&nbsp;million. The $22.1&nbsp;million increase in costs reflected the $20.3&nbsp;million cost for the SEC Settlement and related legal
	and other fees of $4.9&nbsp;million, offset in part by $2.1&nbsp;million of reductions in compensation and benefits from the executive changes announced in August 2015 and lower intangible
	amortization costs due to the full amortization of certain assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Consolidated income tax expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our effective tax rate was 24.5% for 2015 compared to 21.7% for 2014. The low rate in 2015 primarily reflected the impact of a low tax
	rate on the Energy Research Sale from the availability of a deductible basis that was mostly written-off for book purposes in 2012, significant income generated in Europe where we are taxed at a lower
	rate and profitability generated in Asia Pacific where we are not incurring a tax cost due to the availability of net operating losses. These impacts were partially offset by a tax expense of
	$6.5&nbsp;million on a deemed dividend associated with an amendment to the capital structure of our operations outside North America. The low rate in 2014 reflects the impact of strong earnings from
	Europe, where we are taxed at a lower rate, and a $2.7&nbsp;million tax benefit arising from settling multi-year tax return positions offset by establishing additional reserves for other tax
	positions. Our consolidated effective tax rate can vary from period to period depending on, among other factors, the geographic and business mix of our earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_15"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Results of Operation&#151;Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 Compared to Year Ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As noted above, effective in the first quarter of 2015, the Company is presenting its regional segment results excluding the impact of
	corporate activity. Prior period segment data has been restated to conform to the 2015 presentation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Commissions
	and fees decreased due to a 3% reduction in our average daily trading volumes. Although our average revenue per share remained unchanged year over year at $0.0047, the
	proportion of
	average daily volumes executed by lower-priced sell-side clients increased to 52% of our volumes compared to 50% in 2013, reducing our revenue per share. While we also saw lower revenue per share from
	sell-side clients, we continued to see improvement in the revenue per share from buy-side clients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	38
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	higher revenue per share from buy-side clients was driven by higher rates for clients' use of our POSIT Alert block crossing system and our high-touch and portfolio trading services.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	*
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Excludes
	activity from ITG Net commission share arrangements.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recurring
	revenues decreased due to the impact of client attrition from our OMS product, resulting in lower OMS subscription revenues and connectivity fees, partially offset by higher
	research subscriptions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	revenues increased primarily due to an increase in transaction advisory services revenues generated by our energy research team. This increase more than offset a reduction in
	revenues generated by our stock loan matched book business, which included a gain of $2.5&nbsp;million in 2013 related to adjustments to historical dividend withholdings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation
	and employee benefits increased as a result of headcount increases and from higher incentive-based compensation to our management team associated with increased global
	profitability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transaction
	processing costs declined more than the decrease in commissions and fees due to lower options volumes, which incur higher costs proportionally than our cash equity trading
	and lower execution costs from client use of our algorithm technology. As a percentage of commissions and fees, transaction processing costs declined to 17.8% from 18.2% during 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	expenses decreased $12.4&nbsp;million, reflecting lower data center, data and connectivity expenses from our cost reduction initiatives and lower depreciation, software
	amortization and consulting fees. There was also a higher credit for research and development costs charged to other segments. These reductions were partially offset by an increase in employee
	recruiting and legal fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_17"></A>

	Canadian Operations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	39
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=42,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=25011,FOLIO='39',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DI42701A.;10',USER='JTAYLORA',CD='24-FEB-2016;11:21' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK42701_1_40">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Currency translation from a weaker Canadian Dollar decreased total Canadian revenues and expenses by $5.2&nbsp;million and $3.8&nbsp;million, respectively,
	resulting in a decrease of $1.4&nbsp;million to pre-tax income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Canadian
	commissions and fees increased $2.5&nbsp;million despite an unfavorable currency translation of $4.0&nbsp;million, principally due to the growth in MATCH Now volumes of more
	than 80%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recurring
	revenues increased due to a higher number of billable network connections through ITG Net and our billing for market data consumed by clients.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	revenues increased slightly due to an increase in income earned on foreign exchange transactions and principal arbitrage trading, partially offset by losses on client
	accommodations and the impact of currency translation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation
	and employee benefits costs decreased primarily due to the impact of currency translation and a decrease in share-based compensation, which fluctuates for legacy awards to
	Canadian employees based on the changes in the market price of our stock, partially offset by an increase in incentive-based compensation related to increased profitability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transaction
	processing costs decreased due to lower rates for clearing and settlement from contract renegotiation with our clearing provider, lower execution costs as a higher percentage
	of our volume was executed in MATCH Now and the impact of currency translation. As a percentage of commission and fees, transaction processing costs declined to 16.2% from 18.6% in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	decrease in other expenses was primarily driven by lower connectivity expenses and the impact of currency translation, partially offset by higher charges for historical market data
	and legal-related expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_18"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	European Operations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Currency
	translation from a stronger average British Pound increased European revenues and expenses by $6.8&nbsp;million and $5.2&nbsp;million, respectively, adding
	$1.6&nbsp;million to pre-tax income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;European
	results include substantially all the ITG RFQ-hub operations since the July&nbsp;30, 2014 acquisition date, adding $2.0&nbsp;million in revenues, mostly recurring, and
	$2.2&nbsp;million in expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	European commissions and fees grew 43% in 2014 as compared to 2013, far outpacing the 16% growth in market-wide value traded. The investments we made in our infrastructure and our
	product suite resulted in increased activity from buy-side and sell-side clients using our electronic
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	40
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=43,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=1046852,FOLIO='40',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DK42701A.;10',USER='LBURNET',CD='24-FEB-2016;15:01' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK42701_1_41">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	brokerage
	offerings, including our trading algorithms and POSIT, and from clients using our POSIT Alert block crossing system. We also saw increased commissions from the use of our high-touch trading
	services. Commissions and fees also benefitted from $5.9&nbsp;million in favorable currency translation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Recurring
	revenues increased primarily from the new connectivity revenue from ITG RFQ-hub.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation
	and employee benefits increased due to higher incentive-based compensation related to improved performance, increase in headcount, including employees from the ITG RFQ-hub
	acquisition, and the impact of the unfavorable currency translation of $1.7&nbsp;million. This increase was offset, in part, by $3.1&nbsp;million in lower compensation associated with the
	outsourcing of our research and development facility in Israel to a third-party service provider.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transaction
	processing costs increased due to the significant increase in value traded. However, transaction processing costs declined as a percentage of commissions and fees to 23.5%
	from 24.6% in 2013 due to the impact of a higher percentage of our value traded crossed in POSIT, including our POSIT Alert block crossing system, and our initiatives to reduce settlement and clearing
	costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	expenses increased due to higher charges for (a)&nbsp;global research and development costs, (b)&nbsp;historical market data, (c)&nbsp;consulting costs, net of
	capitalization, attributable to the outsourcing of our research and development facility in Israel to a third-party service provider, (d)&nbsp;marketing costs and (e)&nbsp;the additional costs
	added by ITG RFQ-hub.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	nm&#151;Not
	meaningful
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Currency
	translation from a weaker Australian Dollar decreased total Asia Pacific revenues and expenses both by $1.3&nbsp;million, resulting in no impact on our pre-tax loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Asia
	Pacific commissions and fees increased despite a reduction in market-wide trading activity and unfavorable currency translation due to the growth in commissions from clients using
	our POSIT Alert block crossing system and algorithmic trading capabilities as well as from higher commission-sharing revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	growth in recurring revenues primarily reflects growth in the number of billable network connections through ITG Net and the decrease in other revenues is due to higher client trade
	accommodations, which totaled $1.2&nbsp;million in 2014, compared to $0.3&nbsp;million in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	41
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=44,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=872654,FOLIO='41',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DK42701A.;10',USER='LBURNET',CD='24-FEB-2016;15:01' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK42701_1_42">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation
	and employee benefits increased due to increases in headcount and employee termination charges, partially offset by higher capitalized compensation for software development
	and favorable currency translation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transaction
	processing costs decreased due to a reduction in value traded and our efforts to reduce execution and settlement costs. As a percentage of commissions and fees, transaction
	processing costs declined to 25.7% from 28.6% in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	increase in other expenses reflects higher charges for historical market data and global research and development, as well as increases in hardware and software maintenance and
	connectivity, partially offset by reductions in market data costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Corporate
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For 2014, we incurred a pre-tax loss from Corporate activity of $20.5&nbsp;million, reflecting investment income of
	$1.3&nbsp;million and costs of $21.8&nbsp;million. For 2013, we incurred a pre-tax loss from Corporate activity of $25.9&nbsp;million, reflecting investment income of $1.5&nbsp;million and
	costs of $27.4&nbsp;million. Corporate costs in 2013 included $2.6&nbsp;million of duplicate rent charges associated with the build out of our new headquarters in lower Manhattan while we still
	occupied our then-existing headquarters in midtown Manhattan, a $3.9&nbsp;million charge related to our office move, including a reserve for the remaining lease obligation and a $1.5&nbsp;million
	restructuring charge to close our technology research and development facility in Israel. These costs were partially offset by a $1.3&nbsp;million reversal of previously-recorded 2012 and 2011
	restructuring liabilities as a portion of the space vacated in our Los Angeles office was sub-let and certain legal and other employee-related accruals were deemed unnecessary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Consolidated income tax expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our effective tax rate was 21.7% for 2014 compared to 27.8% for 2013. The low rate in both periods is the result of a significantly
	higher proportion of our pre-tax income arising from our European Operations, which is taxed at a lower rate. Additionally, in the U.S. we recorded a $2.7&nbsp;million tax benefit in 2014 for the
	net impact of settling multi-year tax return positions and establishing additional reserves for other tax positions. In 2013, our effective tax rate was favorably impacted by the resolution of a tax
	contingency in Europe and the recognition of the full-year 2012 research and experimentation credit in the U.S. during the first quarter of 2013 due to the timing of tax legislation.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Liquidity
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our primary source of liquidity is cash provided by operations. Our liquidity requirements result from our working capital needs, which
	include clearing and settlement activities, as well as our regulatory capital needs. A substantial portion of our assets is liquid, consisting of cash and cash equivalents or assets readily
	convertible into cash. Cash is principally invested in U.S. government money market mutual funds and other money market mutual funds. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, unrestricted cash and cash
	equivalents totaled $330.7&nbsp;million. Included in this amount is $117.1&nbsp;million of cash and cash equivalents held by subsidiaries outside the United States. Due to the December 2015
	amendment to the capital structure of our operations outside of North America, which included a deemed dividend on all cumulative undistributed earnings, we currently do not foresee a need to
	repatriate funds from certain foreign subsidiaries to the U.S. by way of additional dividends. Should we need to do so in the future, our effective tax rate may increase. As a self-clearing
	broker-dealer in the U.S., we are subject to cash deposit requirements with clearing organizations that may be large in relation to total liquid assets and may fluctuate significantly based upon the
	nature and size of customers' trading activity and market volatility. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had interest-bearing
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	42
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=45,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=716907,FOLIO='42',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DK42701A.;10',USER='LBURNET',CD='24-FEB-2016;15:01' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK42701_1_43">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	security
	deposits totaling $23.3&nbsp;million with clearing organizations in the U.S. for the settlement of equity trades. In the normal course of our U.S. settlement activities, we may also need to
	temporarily finance customer securities positions from short settlements or delivery failures. These financings may be funded from existing cash resources, borrowings under stock loan transactions or
	short-term bank loans under our committed facility. In January 2016, we entered into a new $150&nbsp;million 364-day revolving credit agreement (the "New Credit Agreement") with a syndicate of banks
	and JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., as Administrative Agent. The terms and conditions of the New Credit Agreement are similar to the credit agreement that matured in January 2016 (see Note&nbsp;14,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Borrowings,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and Note&nbsp;24,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Subsequent Events
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), except that the unused commitment fee is 0.75%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	self-clear equity trades in Hong Kong and Australia, maintaining restricted cash deposits of $26.0&nbsp;million primarily to support overdraft facilities and we had deposits with
	clearing organizations of $5.8&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015. In Europe, we maintain $1.6&nbsp;million in restricted cash related to protected client funds and we had deposits with our
	clearing and settlement agents of $41.9&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	expect our cash balance to decline in the first quarter of 2016 as we make tax payments related to the gain from the Energy Research Sale and certain restructurings we have completed,
	as well as upon payment of incentive compensation for 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Capital Resources
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capital resource requirements relate to capital purchases, as well as business investments, and are generally funded from operations.
	When required, as in the case of a major acquisition, our strong cash generating ability has historically allowed us to access U.S. capital markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_20"></A>

</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	decrease in cash flow provided by operating activities for 2015 was driven by lower adjusted net income (see
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Non-GAAP Financial
	Measures
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) and a decrease in accounts payable and accrued expenses. The 2014 increase was driven by strong net income and an increase in accounts payable and accrued expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the normal course of our clearing and settlement activities worldwide, cash is typically used to fund restricted or segregated cash accounts (under regulations and otherwise), broker
	and customer fails to deliver/receive, securities borrowed, deposits with clearing organizations and net activity related to receivables/payables from/to customers and brokers. The cash requirements
	vary from day to day depending on volume transacted and customer trading patterns.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	43
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=46,EFW="2227450",CP="INVESTMENT TECHNOLOGY GROUP, INC",DN="1",CHK=514483,FOLIO='43',FILE='DISK133:[15ZCW1.15ZCW42701]DK42701A.;10',USER='LBURNET',CD='24-FEB-2016;15:01' -->
<A NAME="A2227450Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK42701_1_44">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227450Z10-K_HTM_BG42701A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Investing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash provided by investing activities of $73.3&nbsp;million includes the net proceeds from the Energy Research Sale, partially
	offset by investments in software development projects and computer hardware and software.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Financing Activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net cash used in financing activities of $58.6&nbsp;million primarily reflects repurchases of ITG common stock, our dividend program,
	shares withheld for net settlements of share-based awards and repayments of long-term debt, offset by net proceeds from short-term bank borrowings that are used to support our settlement activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	2015, we repurchased 2.4&nbsp;million shares of our common stock at a cost of approximately $51.0&nbsp;million, which was funded from our available cash resources. Of these
	shares, 2.0&nbsp;million were purchased under our Board of Directors' authorization for a total cost of $42.0&nbsp;million. An additional 0.4&nbsp;million shares ($9.0&nbsp;million) pertained
	solely to the satisfaction of minimum statutory withholding tax upon the net settlement of equity awards. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the total remaining number of shares currently available for
	repurchase under ITG's stock repurchase program was 2.8&nbsp;million. The specific timing and amount of repurchases will vary based on market conditions and other factors. We may elect to conduct
	future share repurchases through open market purchases, private transactions or automatic share repurchase programs under SEC Rule&nbsp;10b5-1.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April 2015, our Board of Directors initiated a dividend program under which we began to pay quarterly dividends, subject to quarterly declarations by the Board of Directors. During
	2015, our Board of Directors declared and we paid quarterly cash dividends of $0.07 per share in each of the second, third and fourth quarters totaling $7.0&nbsp;million, in the aggregate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Regulatory Capital
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ITG&nbsp;Inc., AlterNet and ITG Derivatives are subject to the SEC's Uniform Net Capital Rule (Rule&nbsp;15c3-1), which requires
	the maintenance of minimum net capital. ITG&nbsp;Inc. has elected to use the alternative method permitted by Rule&nbsp;15c3-1, which requires that ITG&nbsp;Inc. maintain minimum net capital
	equal to the greater of $1.0&nbsp;million or 2% of aggregate debit balances arising from customer transactions, as defined. AlterNet and ITG Derivatives have elected to use the basic method
	permitted by Rule&nbsp;15c3-1, which requires that they each maintain minimum net capital equal to the greater of&nbsp;6
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	/
<SMALL>
	3
</SMALL>
	% of aggregate indebtedness or $100,000 and
	$1.0&nbsp;million, respectively. Dividends or withdrawals of capital cannot be made if capital is needed to comply with regulatory requirements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	capital balances and the amounts in excess of required net capital at December&nbsp;31, 2015 for the U.S. Operations are as follows (dollars in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
